intro: Phyllorkis aurata, commonly known as the golden bell heath, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained sandy or rocky soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Phyllorkis aurata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and coastal conditions.
